txt.en:
'Greetings again, [placeholder]. I have faith in my father's plan, but in order not to place too heavy a burden upon Snowbourn, many of our rations must travel with the crofters. 

'Our rations are stored about the town, but I need you to gather them for me, so that Albryt, Odnoth, and I can begin stowing them for the journey.

'Return to me when you have gathered the rations.'
'We shall stow these rations away for the journey. Thank you for your aid, [placeholder].'
Gísling requests your aid in making ready to evacuate the crofters from Garsfeld.

Food-stores can be found scattered about Garsfeld and inside the homes of the town.\n\nGísling wants you to gather food-stores in preparation to evacuate Garsfeld. He has asked that you try to avoid the attention of the crofters so as not to incite panic.
Talk to Gísling at the Mead Hall of Garsfeld\n
Gísling awaits your return in the Mead Hall of Garsfeld.\n\nYou should bring the rations you collected to Gísling.
